summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York and Brianna Coakley, a prosecutor in Florida, regarding the sharing of case files related to Jeffrey Epstein. The SDNY attorney is seeking materials, including grand jury transcripts and signed search warrants, to assist in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Brianna Coakley
persons.role: Division Chief, Special Victims Unit, Office of the State Attorney for the 15th Judicial Circuit
persons.context: She is the Florida prosecutor being contacted by the SDNY to obtain files from her office's prior investigation and prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein. She is coordinating the potential sharing of discovery materials.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the prior investigation and prosecution by the Florida state attorney's office. His case files are being requested by the SDNY.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the SDNY's related prosecution. The request for Epstein files is to assist in her prosecution.

connections.description: Coakley's office previously investigated and prosecuted Epstein, as indicated by the request for her office's files.
The SDNY's prosecution of Maxwell is described as 'related' to the Epstein case, implying an alleged conspiratorial connection.
The SDNY attorney is professionally coordinating with Coakley to obtain evidence for the Maxwell prosecution.
The SDNY attorney is involved in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Initial Request for Epstein Files
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the SDNY emails Brianna Coakley to request her office's files on Jeffrey Epstein to assist in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Follow-up on Missing Grand Jury and Warrant Materials
events.description: The SDNY attorney follows up, noting that grand jury transcripts and signed search warrant materials for Epstein's residence are missing from the provided files and inquires how to obtain them.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Office of the State Attorney for the 15th Judicial Circuit (Florida)
keyFacts: The Southern District of New York was actively seeking evidence from Florida's prior Epstein investigation in October 2020 for the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.
Specific materials noted as missing from the shared files were transcripts of grand jury proceedings and the signed affidavit and warrant to search Epstein's residence.
The correspondence reveals inter-agency coordination between federal (SDNY) and state (Florida) prosecutors in a major sex trafficking case.
Brianna Coakley is identified as a key contact in Florida, holding the position of Division Chief for the Special Victims Unit, focusing on Human Trafficking and ICAC.
